data.title: Things have changed
data.text: I used to travel a lot more to this area and this was always a favorite spot for Thai food. I have not been up here for about 3 years so I was excited to be back there and go back to Toomie's. The food this time was very bland and the service was okay (not bad, not great). Not sure if it was just an off night, but my prior experiences had always been better in terms of service and food.

data.title: Average
data.text:
Fresh spring rolls are 90% lettuce. After the second bite there is no more shrimp.

Chicken salad with lemon and mint is good. I had it twice, and the second time was better less spicy. I always order this as a meal and comma trying to avoid carbs, I don't get white rice. But white rice is important to this salad otherwise The Taste is a little bit overwhelming.

Service is good.

Bathroom facilities are substandard. There is a shared bathroom requiring you to carry an enormous key on a giant ladle.

data.title: Amazing Thai food
data.text:
So we were walking around to find a place to have dinner and passed this restaurant.  After walking 2 blocks we decided to return as it looked the best choice.

Although from the outside it looks like a hole in the wall, but inside it is quite pleasant.  The restaurant is clean and the service excellent with Thai servers (or Asian) so it feels authentic.  I spent a month in Thailand last year (see other reviews if you wish) so I have had a lot of original Thai food.

We order and split as an appetizer item 102 - the Fresh Spring Rolls with shrimp.  For dinner I ordered 211 - Spicy Stir-Fri (Pad Phed) and my girlfriend ordered 215- Yellow Curry (Gang Garee) as they didn't have 216 - Mussamun Curry.  (Because they didn't have something on the menu is why I reduced the overall rating from 5 to 4)

The appetizer was excellent, my Spicy Stir-Fri was fabulous and she said her Yellow Curry was great and ate the whole thing.  I got so much Sitr-Fri that I took a doggie bag home that I will eat for dinner tonight.

With a couple of Thai Singha beers this is one of the best meals I have had in a long time.

We got out of there also for under $50 including a 15% tip.  Good value.

I will return to this restaurant next time I am in town and highly recommend it to all.

data.title: Fresh and great-tasting
data.text:
I left satisfied. Lemongrass chicken salad is excellent. I had it as a meal instead of an appetizer. It would have been better as a meal for two with white rice. The flavor is quite good, but it's a bit bold tasting to eat straight up. That said, I really enjoyed it and would definitely order it again.

The fresh spring rolls with shrimp mediocre. The serving size was large but the quantity of shrimp was small. I like the spicy dipping sauce, although I have no idea what it was.

Service was good.

Price was a bit high.

data.title: Good Food - Hit & Miss Dishes - Understaffed: C+
data.text: It's been years since I was here, and while the food is pretty decent...the wait for the food to arrive is very lengthy during popular times, and they're simply under-staffed and scrambling to keep up.  I suspect only one chef is doing the cooking, but have no knowledge firsthand.  Our Vegetable Combination in Peanut Sauce with Coconut Milk with Meat (Chicken) was very tasty, but the Pad Thai with Chicken was very boring and the noodles were over-cooked.  Overall, rushed service staff and decent food, but lengthy delay in food delivery.  Maybe Pick-Up or Delivery is the way to go?  I've had much better food at other locations throughout the Bay, but nice people.

data.title: Good Thai
data.text: Right in the Heart of downtown Alameda. Very good thai food. The ambience is good but is a little on the dark side but the food is good. Service is good and they do take out. Never had a bad a bad meal there. Curry dishes and the pad thai are very good. A good appetizer is a won ton type fried shrimp.

data.title: Good Lunch Specials
data.text: The lunch specials are great. There is a wide variety of dishes to choose from and the portion is generous. The lunch specials come with daily complementary soup for dine-in. I had the spicy noodles with tofu and vegetables. It was very flavorful. The service was efficient and professional. It's great for a quick lunch during the week.

data.title: Always a good meal...
data.text: We often do take out here,  and really enjoy it.  You certainly will fill up on  the portions.  Friendly staff.

data.title: Thai in Park Street
data.text: We've been going here for years.  There is never a wait, the food is great and well priced.  Thanks Toomie's.

data.title: Hits the spot for quality Tom Kha Gai soup
data.text: I'm picky about my Thai curries and dishes.  Toomie's takes time to cut vegetables uniformly and ensure that the spice level is just right.  Tom Kha soup hits the spot when battling a stuffy nose.

data.title: Coconut chicken soup: don't miss it.
data.text:
One problem with going here is that certain standards are SO good you don't want to digress and try new things. 
Chicken Coconut Soup has lots of mushrooms, deep flavor, but isn't either too salty or too spicy. I've tried this in a lot of places and Toomie's is the bomb. Their pumpkin curry, pad thai, and fresh spring rolls (are the called goi cuon?) are also delicious.  Toomie's is a little expensive, but a lovely relaxing atmosphere for a date night, and it smells nice. 

Downsides:
The bathroom is shared with a couple of other businesses, and is down the hall, and is depressing as hell. It could use a face lift. 

Make sure you hand your server their tip in cash. The owner has gotten in trouble more than once for underpaying their staff and skimming their tips. Not ok. But the food is good and I'd rather their staff not be out of jobs due to a boycott. I hope the economics will work themselves out now that the labor board has an eye on them.

data.title: Good food, but lacking spice
data.text: Our food was good, in general, but a bit lacking in spice. If you like your Thai food spicy, be sure to request it that way. Service is generally good. They have many vegetarian options.

data.title: Our standby
data.text: Toomie's Thai is our favorite Thai restaurant in Alameda. We have been going there for over 5 years. The food is authentic, the quality is high and consistent, the atmosphere is quiet, and the service is consistently excellent. Toomie's was one of the first Thai restaurants in Alameda, and I think they are still the best. In San Francisco, it's Marnee Thai. In Alameda, Toomie's.

data.title: Tasty!
data.text:
This is a very popular place for lunch.
Food is tasty and colorful!
Many choices to choose from.
Try them all!

data.title: Best Thai overall in Alameda
data.text:
I love this place. It may not be the best Thai ever, but It's the best at the dishes that I like to eat when I want Thai. They typically have fast service and good sized portions as well. My Toomies go to dishes:

-Thai egg rolls
-Tom Yum soup
-Tam Kha
-Pad Kee Mao
-Thai Fried Rice
-Spicy Fried Rice
-Special Green Beans with chicken
-Thai Tea

data.title: Thai
data.text: Family restaurant very reasonable and excellent lemon grass soup, have been going there for years and its very reliable quality

data.title: Thai means Toomie's
data.text: One of the best thai food i ever had was from toomie's.Its one of the favorite restaurants of my wife.The service is really great,nice ambiance.i have tried pad thai in lot of other places as well but the one of toomie's is really one of the best.The khao pad ( thai fried rice) is something which you cant find anywhere else.A must try if you are in Alameda...!

data.title: Coconut Milk Seafood Soup, BEST WE EVER HAD.
data.text:
Service is fast friendly and fast. Food is very good, but ask for "mai pet" - not spicy at all  in Thai, otherwise you don't feel full taste of the food. I hope they change ALUMINIUM soup serving bowls to stainless or ceramic as ALUMINIUM IS VERY HARMFUL to our health (Alzheimer disease catalyst). They serve it with flame through the hole in the middle of the bowl.
I told them about aluminum. Will see...  Otherwise excellent food.

data.title: Typical Neighborhood Thai Place
data.text:
I got the "drunk noodles" with chicken to go.  Pretty standard Thai.  The people were very nice, spoke English well enough, and the food was all you'd expect.  Affordable.  Like many Thai places, they are reluctant to go "full heat" on the dishes when asked.  Same goes for this diner, so if you are insatiably seeking spicy heat, make it very clear to them, lest they will hold back!

I also got the "fresh rolls" which were typical, but fresh.  I asked for different types of dipping sauces, and they accommodated me. 

Street parking is scarce in this part of Alameda, but there is a public lot just behind the buesiness across the street.  There is a marked, lit crosswalk for crossing, but be careful.  People are not paying attention. 

This place was recommended to me by the girl at the Hampton Inn down the road, which is also a nice place to visit. I will gladly return to Toomie's.

data.title: Best Thai restaurant in...
data.text: Best Thai restaurant in Alameda if you are looking for REAL Thai food.
